key_title: Key to the genera of Solanaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Solanaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Solanaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Stamens 4, a staminode present or absent
Stamens 5, all functional
Fruit a capsule
Fruit a berry
Corolla-tube exceeding the calyx by c. 5 mm; capsule circumscissile, opening by an apical lid
Corolla-tube exceeding the calyx by much more than 5 mm; capsule opening lengthwise by 2 or 4 valves
Flowers solitary; calyx tubular, base only persistent in fruit; capsule more than 2 cm long, prickly, 4-valved; seeds 2–4 mm long
Flowers in panicles; calyx campanulate, wholly persistent in fruit; capsule less than 2 cm long, smooth, 2-valved; seeds less than 1 mm long
Berry enclosed by calyx; calyx much enlarged and papery in fruit
Berry fully exposed; calyx not or only slightly enlarged in fruit
Flowers blue; ovary 3–5-celled; fruiting calyx deeply 5-partite; plant annual
Flowers white or yellow; ovary 2-celled; fruiting calyx shortly 5-toothed; plant perennial
[link through]
Corolla rotate, stellate, campanulate or urn-shaped
Corolla narrowly funnel-shaped or tubular
Flowers solitary, distant, white; anthers dorsifixed, opening by longitudinal slits, shorter than filaments, not cohering around style
Flowers mostly in axillary clusters, often purplish; anthers basifixed, opening by terminal pores or short slits, longer than filaments, cohering around style
[link through]
Leaves mostly more than 5 cm long, not in clusters, not fleshy; flowers numerous in panicles; corolla more than 15 mm long, reddish or yellowish
Leaves mostly less than 5 cm long, often clustered, sometimes fleshy; flowers solitary or in clusters of 2–4; corolla to c. 10 mm long, white or pink to purplish
